Description: Terra Sigillata wheel-made pottery wall sherd with a porous, red (2.5 YR 4/8) coating. Medium-fine, red (2.5 YR 5/6) micaceous pottery fabric.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by Akademisches Kunstmuseum. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.

Imperial Roman red slip fine tableware sherd of Eastern Terra Sigillata B ware from Ephesus, dated c. 10BC-75AD. Shape unidentified, but see Hayes 1985. However, the identification by Piekarski (2001, 54, no. D33, pl. 26, 2) may be incorrect, as the sherd looks too coarse in the photography for the Ephasus production place suggested, so an Egypt red slip ware production may also be suggested. Hayes, J. W. 1985. Sigillate Orientali. In Encicliopedia dell 'arte antica, atlate della forme ceramica. II ceramica fine Romana nel bacio Mediterraneo (Tarlo ellenism eprimo imperio), pp. 1-96. Rome.
Bibliographic references: Piekarski 2001 / Die Keramik aus Naukratis im Akademischen Kunstmuseum Bonn (p. 54, no. D33, pl. 26, 2)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (IF.081) (Phase 3)
